ground_truth: Michael slowly approaches Gabriel. Jeep gives it some gas, but the engine's not catching. A dark shape pounces onto the hood of the car. The light catches it, revealing the disfigured face and beard of a shopping mall Santa Claus, his oversized belly gruesomely distended. Gabriel raises the mighty mace above his head. Michael closes his eyes. Buzzing surrounds them. Gabriel moves gracefully through the destroyed diner, toward the source of the clicking. He steps behind the counter and finds Bob lying in a massive pool of blood. It takes the creature a moment to realize that the clicking sound is coming from Bob's silver Zippo. Bob is focusing every last ounce of life in his body to lighting that lighter. Bob looks at Gabriel. And with one last brush of his thumb, Bob's trusty Zippo. Gabriel's eyes go wide as the tiny flame dances in front of the stove's broken gas line. Gabriel spins and runs like hell as the gas explodes. The massive explosion rocks the slow moving vehicle. Jeep swings the gun around. Blam! Gabriel takes one in the shoulder, but it doesn't slow him down. Audrey desperately tries to load a flare while avoiding Gabriel's grasp. Jeep can't get off another shot without the risk of hitting Audrey. Gabriel is almost entirely in the car now. Audrey swings the flare gun toward Gabriel, but he knocks her hand aside just as she pulls the trigger and the flare goes off inside the car! Jeep ducks. The car swerves madly. The flare ricochets through the cabin, lighting it up like the Fourth of July! Gabriel lunges for Charlie just as the flare bounces off the windshield - ping! - and nails him right in the face, setting. And that gives Jeep the chance to swing around and fire. He holds onto the car with an iron grip. Starts to pull himself back in. Jeep pulls the trigger again and click. Brings it up to fire, but he's too fast! Whack! Gabriel knocks her into the side of the car with a sweep of his hand. Now he's clawing his way unobstructed toward Charlie again. Charlie pushes herself and the baby down on the floor in front of the passenger seat. Jeep punches it. The speedometer leaps ahead. Gabriel lunges over the passenger seat, grasping for Charlie, his ferocious hand only inches from her and the baby, when Audrey leaps onto Gabriel, pulling him away from Charlie just in time. The intertwined bodies of Gabriel and Audrey hit the road with a sickening crunch and roll into a ball of fire. The Cruiser spins out of control, swerving off the road and careening into a large rock formation.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Michael gradually proceeds toward Gabriel. Jeep provides it some fuel, but the motor's not engaging. A shadowy figure leaps onto the hood of the vehicle. The illumination uncovers it, revealing the malformed visage and whiskers of a shopping mall Santa Claus, his enormous abdomen hideously swollen. Gabriel lifts the powerful club above his head. Michael shuts his eyes. Humming encircles them. Gabriel glides elegantly through the shattered eatery, toward the origin of the ticking. He steps behind the counter and discovers Bob lying in a vast pool of gore. It takes the beast a moment to realize that the ticking noise is emanating from Bob's chrome Zippo. Bob is channeling every last bit of vitality in his form to igniting that lighter. Bob gazes at Gabriel. And with one final flick of his thumb, Bob's reliable Zippo. Gabriel's eyes widen as the small flame dances before the range's fractured gas line. Gabriel pivots and dashes like mad as the gas detonates. The enormous detonation shakes the sluggishly moving automobile. Jeep swivels the gun around. Blam! Gabriel receives one in the arm, but it doesn't hinder him. Audrey frantically attempts to load a signal while dodging Gabriel's clutch. Jeep can't take another shot without the risk of striking Audrey. Gabriel is almost fully in the vehicle now. Audrey swings the flare gun toward Gabriel, but he deflects her hand aside just as she pulls the trigger and the flare goes off inside the vehicle! Jeep crouches. The car veers wildly. The flare rebounds through the cabin, illuminating it like the Fourth of July! Gabriel lunges for Charlie just as the flare bounces off the windshield - ping! - and hits him squarely in the face, igniting. And that provides Jeep the opportunity to pivot and fire. He holds onto the vehicle with a steel clasp. Starts to pull himself back inside. Jeep squeezes the trigger again and click. Raises it to fire, but he's too swift! Whack! Gabriel knocks her into the side of the vehicle with a sweep of his hand. Now he's clawing his way unhindered toward Charlie again. Charlie pushes herself and the infant down on the floor in front of the passenger seat. Jeep accelerates. The speedometer surges ahead. Gabriel lunges over the passenger seat, reaching for Charlie, his ferocious hand only inches from her and the infant, when Audrey leaps onto Gabriel, pulling him away from Charlie just in time. The entangled bodies of Gabriel and Audrey collide with the road with a nauseating crunch and tumble into a ball of fire. The Cruiser spirals out of control, swerving off the road and crashing into a large stone formation.

It is revealed by the light to be the disfigured face and beard of a shopping mall Santa Claus, his oversized belly gruesomely distended. The mighty mace is raised by Gabriel above his head. Gabriel's eyes go wide as the tiny flame is danced by it in front of the stove's broken gas line. Gabriel spins and runs like hell as the gas explodes. The slow moving vehicle is rocked by the massive explosion. The gun is swung around by Jeep. Blam! One is taken in the shoulder by Gabriel, but it doesn't slow him down. Audrey desperately tries loading a flare while she avoids Gabriel's grasp. Another shot can't be gotten off by Jeep without the risk of hitting Audrey. The car is almost entirely entered by Gabriel now. The flare gun is swung by Audrey toward Gabriel, but her hand is knocked aside by him just as she pulls the trigger and the flare goes off inside the car! Jeep ducks. The car is swerved madly. The cabin is ricocheted through by the flare, lighting it up like the Fourth of July! Charlie is lunged for by Gabriel just as the flare bounces off the windshield - ping! - and it nails him right in the face, setting. And Jeep is given the chance to swing around and fire. The car is held onto by him with an iron grip. He starts to pull himself back in. The trigger is pulled again by Jeep and click. It is brought up to fire, but he's too fast! Whack! She is knocked by Gabriel into the side of the car with a sweep of his hand. Now his way is being clawed unobstructedly toward Charlie again. She pushes herself and the baby down on the floor in front of the passenger seat. It is punched by Jeep. The speedometer is leapt ahead. The passenger seat is lunged over by Gabriel, grasping for Charlie, his ferocious hand only inches from her and the baby, when Gabriel is leaped onto by Audrey, pulling him away from Charlie just in time. They hit the road with a sickening crunch and roll into a ball of fire. The Cruiser spins out of control, swerving off the road and careening into a large rock formation.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Michael cautiously approaches Gabriel. The Jeep struggles to start. A dark figure leaps onto the hood, revealing the disfigured face of a mall Santa, with a grotesquely distended belly. Gabriel raises his mace as Michael closes his eyes. Buzzing fills the air. Gabriel moves gracefully through the ruined diner toward the ticking sound. Behind the counter, he finds Bob in a pool of blood, focusing all his energy on lighting a Zippo. The clicking sound comes from Bob's lighter. Bob meets Gabriel's gaze and ignites the Zippo, causing a tiny flame to flicker near the fractured gas line. Gabriel's eyes widen as he runs away from the ensuing explosion, which rocks the vehicle. Jeep aims and fires; Gabriel is hit in the shoulder but keeps moving. Audrey struggles to load a flare, dodging Gabriel's reach. Jeep can't shoot without risking Audrey. Gabriel nearly enters the car as Audrey fires the flare, which ricochets inside and lights the cabin like the Fourth of July. Gabriel lunges for Charlie but is hit in the face by the flare. Jeep seizes the moment to aim and fire. Gabriel swats Audrey aside, advancing toward Charlie and the baby. Charlie pushes herself onto the floor as the Jeep speeds up. Gabriel stretches over the seat for Charlie when Audrey tackles him. They tumble onto the road, engulfed in flames. The Cruiser loses control, veers off, and crashes into a rock formation.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Michael approaches Gabriel as the Jeep's engine struggles. A disfigured mall Santa lands on the hood. Gabriel raises his mace as buzzing surrounds them, finding Bob in a blood pool. The sound comes from Bob's lighter, which ignites gas, causing an explosion. Jeep fires, hitting Gabriel's shoulder. Audrey attempts to load a flare but Gabriel disrupts her. The flare combusts inside the car, and Jeep swerves. Gabriel lunges at Charlie, but Audrey intercepts, both tumbling out in flames. The Cruiser crashes into a rock formation.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Michael, with a sense of caution and apprehension, gradually moves closer to Gabriel. Meanwhile, Jeep attempts to accelerate, but frustratingly, the engine refuses to start. Suddenly, a dark, ominous shape leaps onto the car's hood. The light reveals it to be a distorted visage of a shopping mall Santa Claus, complete with a beard and an oversized belly that is grotesquely swollen. Gabriel prepares to strike, lifting the powerful mace high above his head while Michael, filled with trepidation, closes his eyes. The air around them fills with a buzzing sound.

With a certain elegance, Gabriel navigates through the wreckage of the diner, carefully moving toward the source of an incessant clicking noise. He steps behind the counter and discovers Bob, lying in an enormous pool of blood. It takes a moment for the creature to realize that the persistent clicking sound originates from Bob's silver Zippo lighter. Bob, summoning all his remaining strength, focuses intently on igniting the lighter. He meets Gabriel's gaze, and with his very last bit of energy, flicks the Zippo. Gabriel’s eyes widen in sudden realization as he witnesses the small flame flickering dangerously close to the compromised gas line of the stove. Reacting swiftly, Gabriel spins around and runs for his life as an explosive burst of gas engulfs the area.

The deafening explosion violently shakes the slowly moving vehicle. Jeep hastily maneuvers the gun around and fires with a loud blam! Although Gabriel is hit in the shoulder, he remains undeterred and continues his relentless advance. Meanwhile, Audrey frantically attempts to load a flare, all the while striving to evade Gabriel's clutches. Jeep hesitates to fire again, fearing he might accidentally strike Audrey. Gabriel is almost completely inside the car at this point. Audrey aims the flare gun towards Gabriel, but he deftly deflects her hand just as she squeezes the trigger, causing the flare to discharge within the confined car interior. Jeep instinctively ducks as the car veers wildly off course. The flare ricochets erratically around the cabin, illuminating it with bursts of light reminiscent of a Fourth of July celebration.

With determination, Gabriel lurches forward, reaching for Charlie just as the flare rebounds against the windshield with a sharp ping and strikes him directly in the face. This unexpected turn of events provides Jeep with the crucial opportunity to position himself for another shot. Holding onto the car with fierce tenacity, Jeep readies to pull the trigger once more, only to be thwarted by Gabriel's swift counterattack. In a rapid motion, Gabriel knocks her aside, slamming her against the car's side. Now, unimpeded, he claws his way forward, focusing his sights on Charlie once again. In self-preservation, Charlie pushes herself and the baby to the floor in front of the passenger seat, seeking refuge.

Seizing the moment, Jeep accelerates aggressively, the speedometer needle racing forward. Gabriel lunges over the passenger seat, his menacing hand reaching perilously close to Charlie and her baby. In the nick of time, Audrey heroically leaps onto Gabriel, pulling him away from Charlie and averting disaster. Their bodies, locked in a fierce struggle, crash onto the road with a nauseating crunch, transforming into a rolling ball of flames. The Cruiser spins wildly out of control, eventually swerving off the road and smashing into a substantial rock formation with a forceful impact.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Michael, filled with a sense of both caution and apprehension, gradually inches closer to Gabriel. Meanwhile, Jeep is desperately attempting to accelerate, but to his immense frustration, the engine stubbornly refuses to start. In a startling moment, a dark and ominous shape suddenly leaps onto the car's hood. Under the light, it becomes apparent that the dark form is a distorted visage of a shopping mall Santa Claus, complete with a beard and an oversized belly that appears grotesquely swollen. Gabriel, preparing to strike, lifts the powerful mace high above his head while Michael, filled with trepidation, shuts his eyes tightly. The air around them becomes filled with a disconcerting buzzing sound.

Moving with a certain elegance, Gabriel carefully navigates through the scattered wreckage of the diner, making his way toward the source of an incessant clicking noise. As he steps behind the counter, he discovers Bob, who is lying in an enormous pool of blood. It takes a moment for Gabriel to realize that the persistent clicking sound is coming from Bob's silver Zippo lighter. Bob, summoning all his remaining strength and focus, tries intently to ignite the lighter. He meets Gabriel's gaze, and with his very last bit of energy, flicks the Zippo. Gabriel’s eyes widen with sudden realization as he witnesses the small flame flickering dangerously close to the compromised gas line of the stove. Reacting with swiftness, Gabriel spins around and sprints for his life as an explosive burst of gas violently engulfs the area.

The deafening explosion shakes the vehicle, which is moving slowly. Jeep hastily maneuvers the gun around and fires with a loud "blam!" Although Gabriel is struck in the shoulder, he remains undeterred and persists in his relentless advance. Meanwhile, Audrey frantically tries to load a flare into the flare gun, all the while striving to evade Gabriel's imminent clutches. Jeep hesitates to fire again, fearing he might accidentally strike Audrey. At this point, Gabriel is almost completely inside the car. Audrey aims the flare gun towards Gabriel, but he swiftly deflects her hand just as she pulls the trigger, causing the flare to discharge within the confined interior of the car. Jeep instinctively ducks as the car veers wildly off course. The flare ricochets erratically around the cabin, filling it with bursts of light reminiscent of a vibrant Fourth of July celebration.

With unwavering determination, Gabriel surges forward, reaching towards Charlie just as the flare rebounds against the windshield with a sharp "ping" and strikes him directly in the face. This unexpected turn of events provides Jeep with the crucial opportunity to position himself for another shot. Holding onto the car with fierce tenacity, Jeep readies to pull the trigger once more, only to be thwarted by Gabriel's swift counterattack. In one fluid motion, Gabriel knocks her aside, slamming her against the car's side. Now, without any obstacles, he claws his way forward, focusing his fierce gaze on Charlie once again. In an act of self-preservation, Charlie pushes herself and her baby to the floor in front of the passenger seat, desperately seeking refuge.

Seizing the moment, Jeep accelerates aggressively, the speedometer needle racing forward with urgency. Gabriel lunges over the passenger seat, his menacing hand reaching perilously close to Charlie and her baby. In the nick of time, Audrey heroically leaps onto Gabriel, pulling him away from Charlie and averting disaster. Their bodies, locked in a fierce struggle, crash onto the road with a nauseating crunch, transforming into a rolling ball of flames. The Cruiser spins wildly out of control, eventually swerving off the road and smashing into a substantial rock formation with a forceful impact.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Michael advances slowly toward Gabriel, taking deliberate steps as he closes the gap between them, while Jeep attempts to rev the engine, urging it to catch with a press on the gas pedal, but to no avail. Suddenly, a shadowy figure leaps onto the car's hood, coming into view as the light uncovers the grotesque visage of a shopping mall Santa Claus, his face distorted and framed by an unkempt beard, with an enormous belly protruding unnaturally. Gabriel, unperturbed, hoists a formidable mace high above his head, preparing to strike, while Michael, feeling the tension and impending doom, shuts his eyes tightly. All around them, a buzzing noise fills the air, intensifying the atmosphere. As Gabriel glides smoothly through the wreckage of the diner, he moves with purpose toward the ominous clicking sound. He steps lightly behind the counter to discover Bob lying motionless in a vast sea of his own blood. The creature takes a moment to comprehend that the persistent clicking emanates from Bob's treasured silver Zippo. With his remaining strength, Bob focuses every fragment of his waning life on igniting the lighter. Mustering the last of his will, Bob looks intently at Gabriel, and with one final motion of his thumb, he sparks the Zippo to life. Gabriel's eyes widen in horror as the small flame flickers dangerously close to the broken gas line of the stove. Quickly reacting, Gabriel spins on his heels and sprints away with all his might as the gas ignites in a massive explosion, violently shaking the sluggish vehicle nearby. Seizing the opportunity, Jeep swiftly maneuvers the gun, aiming with precision to fire, and sends a bullet into Gabriel's shoulder, though it fails to slow him down. Meanwhile, Audrey frantically attempts to load a flare into the gun, her hands trembling as she tries to evade Gabriel's advancing grasp. Jeep finds himself unable to fire another shot, fearing he might inadvertently hit Audrey. Gabriel begins to clamber into the car, his presence menacingly close. In a desperate bid to stop him, Audrey swings the flare gun toward Gabriel, but he deftly deflects her hand just as she pulls the trigger, and the flare erupts within the car. Jeep instinctively ducks, causing the vehicle to swerve wildly as the flare ricochets off surfaces, lighting up the car's interior with bursts of light akin to a Fourth of July celebration. Gabriel lunges forward, aiming for Charlie, just as the flare ricochets off the windshield with a sharp "ping" and strikes him in the face, momentarily halting him. This distraction allows Jeep a critical moment to adjust his position and aim. Gripping the car firmly, Gabriel begins to hoist himself back inside, but Jeep pulls the trigger again, only to hear a disheartening click. With swift agility, Gabriel’s hand sweeps, knocking Audrey harshly against the car's interior, freeing his path to Charlie once more. Charlie, sensing the threat, urgently pushes herself and her baby onto the floor before the passenger seat in an attempt to shield them. Jeep responds by slamming the accelerator, causing the speedometer needle to jump forward. As Gabriel lunges over the passenger seat, his hand, fierce and relentless, reaches inches from Charlie and the baby, Audrey intervenes by launching herself at Gabriel, forcibly dragging him away at the crucial moment. The two become entangled, their bodies spiraling into a fiery mass upon hitting the pavement. Simultaneously, the Cruiser loses control, veering off the road and colliding with a massive rock formation, bringing the chaotic scene to a crashing conclusion.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Michael approaches Gabriel as Jeep struggles to start the car. A disfigured shopping mall Santa appears on the hood, while Gabriel raises his mace, and Michael closes his eyes amidst surrounding buzzing. Gabriel gracefully navigates through the destroyed diner to find Bob, who, with his last strength, lights his Zippo near a broken gas line. Realizing the danger, Gabriel runs as the gas explodes, rocking the vehicle. Jeep attempts to shoot Gabriel, hitting him in the shoulder as Audrey tries to load a flare, but Jeep risks hitting her with another shot. Gabriel enters the car as Audrey fires the flare, which ricochets and hits Gabriel in the face. This distraction allows Jeep to fire again as Gabriel advances toward Charlie. Charlie shields herself and the baby on the floor. Jeep accelerates, and Gabriel lunges for Charlie when Audrey tackles him. They both tumble out, engulfed in fire, while the Cruiser spins out, crashing into a rock formation.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Michael, his heart pounding with each step, slowly approaches Gabriel. Jeep, the nickname for the rugged vehicle renowned for its ability to handle rough terrains, gives it some gas, but the engine's not catching due to a mechanical issue. A dark shape pounces onto the hood of the car. The light catches it, revealing the disfigured face and beard of a shopping mall Santa Claus, known for entertaining children during the holiday season, his oversized belly gruesomely distended from some unnatural curse. Gabriel raises the mighty mace above his head, a weapon reminiscent of ancient warriors. Michael closes his eyes, steeling himself for the impending chaos. Buzzing surrounds them like a swarm of angry bees. Gabriel moves gracefully through the destroyed diner, once a bustling hub for weary travelers craving a hot meal, toward the source of the clicking. He steps behind the counter and finds Bob lying in a massive pool of blood. It takes the creature a moment to realize that the clicking sound is coming from Bob's silver Zippo, a type of lighter known for its durability and windproof flame. Bob is focusing every last ounce of life in his body to lighting that lighter. Bob looks at Gabriel. And with one last brush of his thumb, Bob's trusty Zippo ignites. Gabriel's eyes go wide as the tiny flame dances in front of the stove's broken gas line, a potential powder keg. Gabriel spins and runs like hell as the gas explodes, the kind of blast that leaves nothing untouched. The massive explosion rocks the slow-moving vehicle. Jeep swings the gun around. Blam! Gabriel takes one in the shoulder, but it doesn't slow him down, driven by an unnatural resilience. Audrey desperately tries to load a flare while avoiding Gabriel's grasp. Jeep can't get off another shot without the risk of hitting Audrey, a risk too great to take. Gabriel is almost entirely in the car now. Audrey swings the flare gun toward Gabriel, but he knocks her hand aside just as she pulls the trigger, and the flare goes off inside the car, filling it with a fiery light. Jeep ducks as the car swerves madly. The flare ricochets through the cabin, lighting it up like the Fourth of July, known for its brilliant fireworks displays. Gabriel lunges for Charlie just as the flare bounces off the windshield with a metallic ping and nails him right in the face, setting him ablaze. And that gives Jeep the chance to swing around and fire. He holds onto the car with an iron grip, taught through years of surviving under pressure. Starts to pull himself back in, adrenaline pumping fiercely. Jeep pulls the trigger again and click, the gun out of ammo. Brings it up to fire, but he's too fast! Whack! Gabriel knocks her into the side of the car with a sweep of his hand, a move filled with terrifying strength. Now he's clawing his way unobstructed toward Charlie again. Charlie pushes herself and the baby down on the floor in front of the passenger seat, instilled with a maternal instinct to protect. Jeep punches it, accelerating with a frantic urgency. The speedometer leaps ahead, a gauge that marks their increasing speed. Gabriel lunges over the passenger seat, grasping for Charlie, his ferocious hand only inches from her and the baby, when Audrey leaps onto Gabriel, pulling him away from Charlie just in time with a heroic effort. The intertwined bodies of Gabriel and Audrey hit the road with a sickening crunch and roll into a ball of fire. The Cruiser, another term for this iconic vehicle, spins out of control, swerving off the road and careening into a large rock formation, the type sculpted by years of natural erosion.

Gabriel lunges over the passenger seat grasping for Charlie his ferocious hand only inches from her and the baby when Audrey leaps onto Gabriel pulling him away from Charlie just in time. The intertwined bodies of Gabriel and Audrey hit the road with a sickening crunch and roll into a ball of fire. The Cruiser spins out of control swerving off the road and careening into a large rock formation.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Michael slowly approaches Gabriel. Jeep gives it some gas but the engine's not catching. A dark shape pounces onto the hood of the car. The light catches it revealing the disfigured face and beard of a shopping mall. Santa Claus his oversized belly gruesomely distended. Gabriel raises the mighty mace above his head. Michael closes his eyes. Buzzing surrounds them. Gabriel moves gracefully through the destroyed diner toward the source of the clicking. He steps behind the counter and finds Bob lying in a massive pool of blood. It takes the creature a moment to realize that the clicking sound is coming from Bob's silver Zippo. Bob is focusing every last ounce of life in his body to lighting that lighter. Bob looks at Gabriel. And with one last brush of his thumb Bob's trusty Zippo. Gabriel's eyes go wide as the tiny flame dances in front of the stove's broken gas line. Gabriel spins and runs like hell as the gas explodes. The massive explosion rocks the slow moving vehicle. Jeep swings the gun around. Blam. Gabriel takes one in the shoulder but it does not slow him down. Audrey desperately tries to load a flare while avoiding Gabriel's grasp. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: Jeep slowly approaches Audrey. A sparrow gives it some gas, but the engine's not catching. A dark shape pounces onto the hood of the car. The light catches it, revealing the disfigured face and beard of a shopping mall Santa Claus, his oversized belly gruesomely distended. Audrey raises the mighty mace above her head. Jeep closes his eyes. Buzzing surrounds them. Audrey moves gracefully through the destroyed diner, toward the source of the clicking. She steps behind the counter and finds Michael lying in a massive pool of blood. It takes the tortoise a moment to realize that the clicking sound is coming from Michael's silver Zippo. Michael is focusing every last ounce of life in his body to lighting that lighter. Michael looks at Audrey. And with one last brush of his thumb, Michael's trusty Zippo. Audrey's eyes go wide as the tiny flame dances in front of the stove's broken gas line. Audrey spins and runs like hell as the gas explodes. The massive explosion rocks the slow moving vehicle. A dolphin swings the gun around. Blam! Audrey takes one in the shoulder, but it doesn't slow her down. Charlie desperately tries to load a flare while avoiding Audrey's grasp. A dolphin can't get off another shot without the risk of hitting Charlie. Audrey is almost entirely in the car now. Charlie swings the flare gun toward Audrey, but she knocks Charlie's hand aside just as Charlie pulls the trigger and the flare goes off inside the car! A dolphin ducks. The car swerves madly. The flare ricochets through the cabin, lighting it up like the Fourth of July! Audrey lunges for Gabriel just as the flare bounces off the windshield - ping! - and nails her right in the face, setting. And that gives a dolphin the chance to swing around and fire. He holds onto the car with an iron grip. Starts to pull himself back in. A dolphin pulls the trigger again and click. Brings it up to fire, but he's too fast! Whack! Audrey knocks a raccoon into the side of the car with a sweep of her hand. Now she's clawing her way unobstructed toward Gabriel again. Gabriel pushes herself and the baby down on the floor in front of the passenger seat. A dolphin punches it. The speedometer leaps ahead. Audrey lunges over the passenger seat, grasping for Gabriel, her ferocious hand only inches from her and the baby, when a raccoon leaps onto Audrey, pulling her away from Gabriel just in time. The intertwined bodies of Audrey and a raccoon hit the road with a sickening crunch and roll into a ball of fire. The Cruiser spins out of control, swerving off the road and careening into a large rock formation.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Michael slowly approaches Gabriel. Boat gives it some gas, but the rotor's not catching. A dark shape pounces onto the hood of the vehicle. The light catches it, revealing the disfigured face and beard of a theme park clown, his oversized shoes grotesquely inflated. Gabriel raises the mighty scepter above his head. Michael closes his eyes. Buzzing surrounds them. Gabriel moves gracefully through the abandoned bakery, toward the source of the ticking. He steps behind the register and finds Bob lying in a massive puddle of ketchup. It takes the creature a moment to realize that the ticking sound is coming from Bob's silver stopwatch. Bob is focusing every last ounce of life in his body to snapping that watch. Bob looks at Gabriel. And with one last brush of his thumb, Bob's trusty stopwatch. Gabriel's eyes go wide as the tiny sparkler dances in front of the furnace's broken gas line. Gabriel spins and runs like hell as the gas explodes. The massive explosion rocks the slow moving aircraft. Boat swings the slingshot around. Blam! Gabriel takes one in the shoulder, but it doesn't slow him down. Audrey desperately tries to load a confetti popper while avoiding Gabriel's grasp. Boat can't get off another shot without the risk of hitting Audrey. Gabriel is almost entirely in the vehicle now. Audrey swings the confetti gun toward Gabriel, but he knocks her hand aside just as she pulls the trigger and the popper goes off inside the vehicle! Boat ducks. The vehicle swerves madly. The confetti ricochets through the cabin, lighting it up like a New Year's Eve celebration! Gabriel lunges for Charlie just as the confetti bounces off the windshield - ping! - and nails him right in the face, setting. And that gives Boat the chance to swing around and fire. He holds onto the vehicle with an iron grip. Starts to pull himself back in. Boat pulls the trigger again and click. Brings it up to fire, but he's too fast! Whack! Gabriel knocks her into the side of the vehicle with a sweep of his hand. Now he's clawing his way unobstructed toward Charlie again. Charlie pushes herself and the baby down on the floor in front of the co-pilot seat. Boat punches it. The speedometer leaps ahead. Gabriel lunges over the co-pilot seat, grasping for Charlie, his ferocious hand only inches from her and the baby, when Audrey leaps onto Gabriel, pulling him away from Charlie just in time. The intertwined bodies of Gabriel and Audrey hit the road with a sickening crunch and roll into a ball of cheese. The Glider spins out of control, swerving off the road and careening into a large sand dune.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Michael quickly departs from Gabriel. Jeep revs the engine, but the transmission's not engaging. A dark shape floats onto the hood of the car. The light exposes it, revealing the scarred face and beard of a shopping mall Santa Claus, his oversized belly awkwardly protruding. Gabriel lowers the mighty mace beside his head. Michael opens his eyes. Buzzing dissipates around them. Gabriel glides clumsily through the destroyed diner, away from the source of the clicking. He hops over the counter and spots Bob reclining in a massive pool of blood. It takes the creature a moment to understand that the clicking sound is emanating from Bob's silver Zippo. Bob is diverting every last ounce of life in his body to resisting that lighter. Bob stares at Gabriel. And with one last flick of his thumb, Bob's trusty Zippo. Gabriel's eyes narrow as the tiny flame flickers in front of the stove's broken gas line. Gabriel spins and strolls away as the gas implodes. The massive implosion jars the slow moving vehicle. Jeep waves the gun around. Blam! Gabriel takes one in the shoulder, but he doesn't react. Audrey calmly tries to disassemble a flare while avoiding Gabriel's grasp. Jeep can't set aside another shot without the risk of hitting Audrey. Gabriel is nearly entirely in the car now. Audrey bumps the flare gun toward Gabriel, but he holds her hand aside just as she presses the trigger and the flare goes off outside the car! Jeep crouches. The car sways gently. The flare bounces through the cabin, dimming it like a rainy day! Gabriel reaches for Charlie just as the flare bounces off the windshield - ping! - and kisses him right in the face, missing. And that gives Jeep the opportunity to slide around and yawn. He clings to the car with a loose grip. Attempts to pull himself back in. Jeep squeezes the trigger again and click. Grasps it up to laugh, but he's too nimble! Whack! Gabriel nudges her into the side of the car with a flick of his hand. Now he's gliding his way uninterrupted toward Charlie again. Charlie pulls herself and the baby up on the floor in front of the passenger seat. Jeep slams the brake. The speedometer halts. Gabriel rolls over the passenger seat, reaching for Charlie, his gentle hand only inches from her and the baby, when Audrey jumps onto Gabriel, nudging him away from Charlie just in time. The entwined bodies of Gabriel and Audrey hit the road with a sickening thud and roll into a ball of smoke. The Cruiser idles in control, gliding off the road and grazing a large rock formation.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Samuel slowly approaches Victoria. Motorcycle gives it some gas, but the blender's not catching. A bright shape pounces onto the hood of the spaceship. The shadow catches it, revealing the elegant face and mane of a circus clown, his oversized hat gruesomely distended. Victoria raises the massive net above her arm. Samuel closes his ears. Humming surrounds them. Victoria moves gracefully through the destroyed warehouse, toward the source of the ticking. She steps behind the tree and finds Lisa lying in a massive pool of water. It takes the phantom a moment to realize that the ticking sound is coming from Lisa's golden candle. Lisa is focusing every last ounce of hope in her soul to igniting that match. Lisa looks at Victoria. And with one last flick of her thumb, Lisa's trusty candle. Victoria's hands go wide as the tiny spark dances in front of the microwave's broken power cord. Victoria spins and runs like lightning as the power ignites. The massive ignition rocks the slow-moving scooter. Motorcycle swings the knife around. Blam! Victoria takes one in the knee, but it doesn't slow her down. Sarah desperately tries to load a frisbee while avoiding Victoria's grip. Motorcycle can't get off another swing without the risk of hitting Sarah. Victoria is almost entirely on the boat now. Sarah swings the frisbee toward Victoria, but she knocks her wrist aside just as she throws the frisbee and the disc goes off inside the boat! Motorcycle ducks. The boat swerves wildly. The frisbee ricochets through the cabin, lighting it up like New Year's Eve! Victoria lunges for Alex just as the frisbee bounces off the windshield - ping! - and nails her right in the hand, setting. And that gives Motorcycle the chance to swing around and punch. He holds onto the boat with a steel grip. Starts to pull himself back in. Motorcycle pulls the trigger again and click. Brings it up to swing, but he's too quick! Whack! Victoria knocks him into the side of the boat with a sweep of her leg. Now she's clawing her way unobstructed toward Alex again. Alex pushes himself and the kitten down on the floor in front of the driver's seat. Motorcycle punches it. The thermometer leaps ahead. Victoria lunges over the driver's seat, grasping for Alex, her ferocious foot only inches from him and the kitten, when Sarah leaps onto Victoria, pulling her away from Alex just in time. The intertwined bodies of Victoria and Sarah hit the ocean with a sickening crunch and roll into a ball of water. The Raft spins out of control, swerving off the road and careening into a giant ice sculpture.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Jonathan cautiously advances toward Lucas. The tractor revs its engine, but the ignition isn't taking. A shadowy figure leaps onto the roof of the vehicle. The glow illuminates it, showing the distorted visage and whiskers of a carnival clown, his colossal belly grotesquely inflated. Lucas lifts the formidable hammer above his head. Jonathan shuts his eyes. Humming envelops them. Lucas maneuvers elegantly through the ruined bakery, toward the origin of the snapping. He bends behind the booth and discovers Jim sprawled in a vast puddle of blood. It takes the beast a moment to understand that the snapping noise is emanating from Jim's golden watch. Jim is channeling every last bit of strength in his frame to activate that watch. Jim gazes at Lucas. And with one final flick of his wrist, Jim's dependable Zippo. Lucas's eyes widen as the tiny flame flickers in front of the oven's ruptured gas line. Lucas twirls and dashes like the wind as the gas detonates. The enormous blast jolts the sluggish transport. The tractor swivels the cannon around. Boom! Lucas takes one in the leg, but it doesn't hinder him. Emily frantically attempts to load a firework while dodging Lucas's clutch. The tractor can't get off another burst without risking hitting Emily. Lucas is almost completely in the vehicle now. Emily waves the flare gun toward Lucas, but he shoves her arm aside just as she fires and the flare ignites inside the vehicle! The tractor operator ducks. The vehicle veers wildly. The flare ricochets within the cabin, illuminating it spectacularly! Lucas dives for Sam just as the flare rebounds off the dashboard - ping! - and strikes him directly in the face, setting. And that provides the tractor the opportunity to pivot and shoot. He grips the vehicle with a steel-like grasp. Begins to draw himself back inside. The tractor operator presses the trigger once more and click. Lifts it to shoot, but he's too swift! Wham! Lucas propels her into the wall of the vehicle with a flick of his wrist. Now he's clawing his way unhindered toward Sam once more. Sam pushes herself and the infant onto the floor in front of the console. The tractor speeds up. The odometer jumps forward. Lucas dives over the console, reaching for Sam, his fierce hand mere inches from her and the infant, when Emily leaps onto Lucas, dragging him away from Sam just in the nick of time. The tangled forms of Lucas and Emily hit the pavement with a nauseating crunch and tumble into a blaze of fire. The Tractor spins out of control, skidding off the path and crashing into a massive rock structure.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Michael casually approaches Gabriel. Submarine gives it some steam, but the propeller's not spinning. A bright configuration leaps onto the prow of the boat. The shadow illuminates it, revealing the distorted face and mustache of a carnival clown, his enormous hat grotesquely exaggerated. Gabriel lifts the grandiose staff above his head. Michael closes his eyes. Chirping envelops them. Gabriel glides swiftly through the shattered pizzeria, toward the source of the popping. He slips behind the curtain and finds Bob resting in an enormous pile of feathers. It takes the apparition a moment to understand that the popping sound is coming from Bob's golden harmonica. Bob is channeling every last breath in his body into playing that instrument. Bob looks at Gabriel. And with one last slide of his lips, Bob's faithful harmonica. Gabriel's eyes go wide as the faint melody dances in front of the fireplace's broken chimney. Gabriel twirls and runs like the wind as the fire erupts. The colossal eruption shakes the speedy train. Submarine swings the camera around. Snap! Gabriel takes one in the elbow, but it doesn't slow him down. Audrey desperately tries to load a slingshot while evading Gabriel’s reach. Submarine can't take another picture without the risk of capturing Audrey. Gabriel is almost entirely in the boat now. Audrey swings the slingshot toward Gabriel, but he pushes her hand away just as she releases the stone and the projectile flies off inside the boat! Submarine ducks. The boat zigzags erratically. The stone ricochets through the cabin, illuminating it like New Year's Eve! Gabriel dives for Charlie just as the projectile bounces off the window - ping! - and hits him square in the nose, igniting. And that gives Submarine the chance to swing around and capture. He clings onto the boat with a steel grip. Begins to haul himself back in. Submarine snaps the photo again and thud. Raises it up to capture, but he's too swift! Bam! Gabriel shoves her into the side of the boat with a flick of his wrist. Now he's scrambling his way unchecked toward Charlie again. Charlie nudges herself and the infant down on the floor in front of the lounge chair. Submarine accelerates. The tachometer surges forward. Gabriel vaults over the lounge chair, reaching for Charlie, his fierce hand only inches from her and the infant, when Audrey leaps onto Gabriel, dragging him away from Charlie just in time. The tangled forms of Gabriel and Audrey hit the pavement with a nauseating crunch and transform into a blaze. The Chariot spins uncontrollably, veering off the track and crashing into a towering sculpture.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Elena quickly marches toward Trevor. Bicycle pedals harder, but the pedals aren't turning. A bright figure leaps atop the roof of the subway. The darkness reveals it, uncovering the smooth hair and cape of a pastry chef, her minuscule backpack beautifully inflated. Trevor lifts the tiny screwdriver above her feet. Elena opens her mouth. Drumming engulfs them. Trevor drifts clumsily through the wrecked library, away from the location of the ticking. She strolls above the bookshelf and discovers Sam floating in a gigantic cup of tea. It takes the monster a week to understand that the ticking noise is emerging from Sam's golden watch. Sam is dedicating every first moment of silence in her chair to watching that wristwatch. Sam gazes at Trevor. And with one first whisper of her toe, Sam's forgotten watch. Trevor's feet squish small as the enormous water splashes under the pool's fixed diving board. Trevor slides and dances like a cat as the water implodes. The tiny implosion races the already stopped carriage. Bicycle tosses the cup around. Ding! Trevor receives one on the ankle, but it doesn't stop her up. Sarah enthusiastically attempts to toss a disk while dodging Trevor's hug. Bicycle can't get in another dance without the chance of hugging Sarah. Trevor is completely outside the subway now. Sarah tosses the disk cup toward Trevor, but she hugs his feet alongside just as he pushes the pedal and the disk turns on alongside the subway! Bicycle stands. The subway flips calmly. The disk reflects around the engine, darkening it down like the Halloween of November! Trevor skips for Taylor just as the disk rolls off the rearview mirror - zing! - and pats him right on the back, holding. And that takes Bicycle the challenge to drop down and dance. She releases onto the subway with a cloth grip. Tries to push herself forward in. Bicycle pushes the pedal quietly and clunk. Watches it down to dance, but she's too slow! Tap! Trevor hugs him into the back of the subway with a swipe of his feet. Now she's dragging her way gently from Taylor again. Taylor pulls herself and the kitten up under the ceiling in back of the driver's window. Bicycle kicks it. The thermometer drags behind. Trevor skips under the driver's window, leaping for Taylor, her gentle foot far from him and the kitten, when Sarah skips under Trevor, pushing him away from Taylor slowly in place. The connected heads of Trevor and Sarah jump the path with a happy giggle and sing into a sound of ice. The Bicycle twirls in control, flipping off the path and floating into a small waterfall display.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Michael approaches Gabriel as a Jeep fails to start. A dark figure, a disfigured mall Santa, lands on the car. Inside a destroyed diner, Gabriel investigates a clicking sound and finds Bob in a pool of blood, his Zippo lighter sparking a massive gas explosion. The blast hits the vehicle, and Gabriel is shot in the shoulder by Jeep but remains undeterred. Audrey struggles to load a flare gun as Gabriel climbs into the car, causing chaos when the flare ignites inside. As Gabriel lunges at Charlie, Audrey intervenes, tackling him out of the vehicle. They crash onto the road, engulfed in flames, while the Cruiser veers out of control, slamming into a rock formation.

Gabriel spins and runs like hell as the gas explodes Gabriel's eyes go wide as the tiny flame dances in front of the stove's broken gas line And with one last brush of his thumb Bob's trusty Zippo Bob looks at Gabriel Bob is focusing every last ounce of life in his body to lighting that lighter It takes the creature a moment to realize that the clicking sound is coming from Bob's silver Zippo He steps behind the counter and finds Bob lying in a massive pool of blood Gabriel moves gracefully through the destroyed diner toward the source of the clicking Buzzing surrounds them Michael closes his eyes Gabriel raises the mighty mace above his head Santa Claus his oversized belly gruesomely distended The light catches it revealing the disfigured face and beard of a shopping mall A dark shape pounces onto the hood of the car Jeep gives it some gas but the engine's not catching Michael slowly approaches Gabriel

test_cases.name: Jumble Segments Order
test_cases.description: He steps behind the counter and finds Bob lying in a massive pool of blood The light catches it revealing the disfigured face and beard of a shopping mall It takes the creature a moment to realize that the clicking sound is coming from Bob's silver Zippo The flare ricochets through the cabin lighting it up like the Fourth of July Jeep punches it Blam Gabriel lunges over the passenger seat grasping for Charlie his ferocious hand only inches from her and the baby when Audrey leaps onto Gabriel pulling him away from Charlie just in time The car swerves madly Santa Claus his oversized belly gruesomely distended Whack Gabriel is almost entirely in the car now Bob is focusing every last ounce of life in his body to lighting that lighter He holds onto the car with an iron grip Jeep cannot get off another shot without the risk of hitting Audrey Bob looks at Gabriel Jeep ducks Now he is clawing his way unobstructed toward Charlie again Charlie pushes herself and the baby down on the floor in front of the passenger seat Brings it up to fire but he is too fast And with one last brush of his thumb Bob's trusty Zippo Audrey swings the flare gun toward Gabriel but he knocks her hand aside just as she pulls the trigger and the flare goes off inside the car Audrey desperately tries to load a flare while avoiding Gabriel's grasp And that gives Jeep the chance to swing around and fire The speedometer leaps ahead Starts to pull himself back in Gabriel takes one in the shoulder but it does not slow him down The massive explosion rocks the slow moving vehicle The Cruiser spins out of control swerving off the road and careening into a large rock formation Gabriel knocks her into the side of the car with a sweep of his hand Jeep pulls the trigger again and click Michael slowly approaches Gabriel A dark shape pounces onto the hood of the car Gabriel lunges for Charlie just as the flare bounces off the windshield  ping  and nails him right in the face setting Gabriel raises the mighty mace above his head Michael closes his eyes Gabriel moves gracefully through the destroyed diner toward the source of the clicking Gabriel's eyes go wide as the tiny flame dances in front of the stove's broken gas line Gabriel spins and runs like hell as the gas explodes Jeep swings the gun around Jeep gives it some gas but the engine's not catching Buzzing surrounds them The intertwined bodies of Gabriel and Audrey hit the road with a sickening crunch and roll into a ball of fire
